meanings.definition: To roll up and secure (a sail or flag) to a spar or around a mast.
meanings.sent1: The sailor will furl the sail before the storm.
meanings.sent2: She learned how to furl the flag properly.
meanings.sent3: The pirate tried to furl the sail, but it ended up wrapped around him instead.
meanings.sent4: The memories furl around my mind like a tightly secured sail.
meanings.sent5: With precision, he furls the flag, each fold a testament to his skill.

meanings.definition: To wrap or roll (something) up neatly.
meanings.sent1: Please furl the blanket before putting it away.
meanings.sent2: He likes to furl his clothes neatly in the drawer.
meanings.sent3: The cat decided to furl itself into a cozy ball on the couch.
meanings.sent4: She furls her hair into a bun every morning.
meanings.sent5: The artist furls the canvas, each stroke wrapping it into a masterpiece.

meanings.definition: To gather into a compact roll.
meanings.sent1: The scroll furls tightly, preserving the ancient writing.
meanings.sent2: He furls the map carefully to fit it in his pocket.
meanings.sent3: The magician furls the scarf into a small ball and makes it disappear.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds furl ominously in the sky.
meanings.sent5: She furls the paper into a tiny scroll, ready to be sealed with wax.
